hygiene.title: Basic Hygiene for Health
hygiene.description: Simple practices like handwashing and food safety

content.introduction: Proper hygiene is the foundation of good health and disease prevention in rural communities.

handHygiene.title: Hand Hygiene
handHygiene.content: Wash your hands frequently with soap and clean water for at least 20 seconds, especially before eating, after using the toilet, and after handling animals or waste.

foodSafety.title: Food Safety
foodSafety.content: Keep food covered, cook thoroughly, and store leftovers properly. Wash fruits and vegetables before consumption.

personalCleanliness.title: Personal Cleanliness
personalCleanliness.content: Bathe regularly, keep nails trimmed and clean, brush teeth twice daily, and wear clean clothes.

keyTips.tip1: Use soap and clean water for handwashing
keyTips.tip2: Cover food to protect from flies and contamination
keyTips.tip3: Boil water if you're unsure about its safety
keyTips.tip4: Keep living areas clean and well-ventilated

first-aid.title: Essential First Aid Skills
first-aid.description: A quick guide to basic first aid techniques for emergencies

content.introduction: Basic first aid knowledge can save lives in emergency situations when professional medical help is not immediately available.

woundCare.title: Wound Care
woundCare.content: Clean hands first, stop bleeding with direct pressure, clean wound gently with clean water, apply antiseptic if available, and cover with clean bandage.

burns.title: Burns Treatment
burns.content: Cool the burn with clean, cool water for 10-15 minutes. Do not use ice. Remove jewelry before swelling occurs. Cover with clean, dry cloth.

fever.title: Fever Management
fever.content: Give plenty of fluids, use cool compresses on forehead, remove excess clothing, and seek medical help if fever persists or exceeds 103°F (39.4°C).

keyTips.tip1: Always clean your hands before providing first aid
keyTips.tip2: Call for professional medical help when possible
keyTips.tip3: Keep a basic first aid kit readily available
keyTips.tip4: Know when to seek immediate medical attention

water-safety.title: Ensuring Safe Drinking Water
water-safety.description: Methods for purifying water and understanding local water sources

content.introduction: Access to safe drinking water is essential for preventing waterborne diseases and maintaining good health.

purification.title: Water Purification Methods
purification.content: Boil water for at least 1 minute, use water purification tablets, or employ simple filtration methods using clean cloth and sand.

storage.title: Water Storage
storage.content: Store purified water in clean, covered containers. Clean storage containers regularly with soap and safe water.

protection.title: Source Protection
protection.content: Protect water sources from contamination by keeping animals and waste away from wells and water bodies.

keyTips.tip1: Boiling is the most reliable method of water purification
keyTips.tip2: Store water in clean, covered containers
keyTips.tip4: Test water quality regularly if possible

disease-prevention.title: Understanding Common Diseases
disease-prevention.description: Information on identifying symptoms, preventing transmission

content.introduction: Understanding common diseases helps in early recognition, prevention, and seeking appropriate treatment.

waterborne.title: Waterborne Diseases
waterborne.content: Diarrhea, cholera, and typhoid spread through contaminated water. Symptoms include stomach pain, vomiting, and loose stools.

vectorborne.title: Vector-borne Diseases
vectorborne.content: Malaria, dengue, and chikungunya spread through mosquito bites. Prevent by eliminating standing water and using bed nets.

respiratory.title: Respiratory Infections
respiratory.content: Common cold, flu, and tuberculosis spread through air droplets. Cover mouth when coughing or sneezing.

keyTips.tip1: Practice good hygiene to prevent disease transmission
keyTips.tip2: Seek medical attention for persistent symptoms
keyTips.tip4: Report unusual disease patterns to health authorities

nutrition.title: Healthy Eating for Families
nutrition.description: Tips for balanced nutrition using locally available foods

content.introduction: Good nutrition supports immune function and overall health, especially important for growing children and pregnant women.

balanced.title: Balanced Diet Basics
balanced.content: Include grains, vegetables, fruits, proteins (dal, eggs, meat), and dairy in daily meals. Eat a variety of colorful foods.

child.title: Child Nutrition
child.content: Breastfeed exclusively for first 6 months, introduce complementary foods gradually, and ensure adequate protein for growth.

safety.title: Food Safety
safety.content: Store food properly, cook thoroughly, consume fresh foods when possible, and maintain kitchen hygiene.

keyTips.tip1: Eat a variety of foods for complete nutrition
keyTips.tip2: Include iron-rich foods like green leafy vegetables
keyTips.tip3: Ensure children receive adequate calories for growth
keyTips.tip4: Practice proper food storage and preparation

maternal-health.title: Maternal & Child Health
maternal-health.description: Essential care during pregnancy and early childhood

content.introduction: Proper care during pregnancy and early childhood lays the foundation for lifelong health and development.

prenatal.title: Prenatal Care
prenatal.content: Regular check-ups, proper nutrition, iron and folic acid supplements, and avoiding harmful substances during pregnancy.

delivery.title: Safe Delivery
delivery.content: Plan for skilled birth attendance, prepare for emergency complications, and ensure clean delivery environment.

newborn.title: Newborn Care
newborn.content: Immediate breastfeeding, keeping baby warm, cord care, and recognizing danger signs in newborns.

keyTips.tip1: Start prenatal care early in pregnancy
keyTips.tip2: Take iron and folic acid supplements as prescribed
keyTips.tip4: Recognize and respond to danger signs promptly
